wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant General Sir Simon Vincent Mayall,  (born 7 March 1956) is a retired British Army officer and a Middle East Adviser at the Ministry of Defence.

link_mentions.page: Deputy Chief of the Defence Staff

response: *Lieutenant General Simon Mayall (born 1956), former Deputy Chief of the Defence Staff

Under the Queen's Regulations for the Army, the office of Constable is conferred upon a field marshal or a retired general officer for a five-year term.The Queen's Regulations for the Army (Ministry of Defence): Chapter 9, Annex B.  The Constable appointed in 2016 is General Sir Nick Houghton. The Constable's ceremonial deputy is the Lieutenant of the Tower of London, currently Simon Mayall;
